title: SCAM Directive Generator Options Schema

examples.description: Generate a `MySampleDirective` directive in a `my-sample` folder in the `my-lib` library

description: Creates a new, generic Angular directive definition in the given or default project.

name.x-prompt: What name would you like to use for the directive?

directory.description: The directory at which to create the SCAM Directive files. When `--nameAndDirectoryFormat=as-provided`, it will be relative to the current working directory. Otherwise, it will be relative to the workspace root.

nameAndDirectoryFormat.description: Whether to generate the component in the directory as provided, relative to the current working directory and ignoring the project (`as-provided`) or generate it using the project and directory relative to the workspace root (`derived`).

project.x-deprecated: Provide the `directory` option instead and use the `as-provided` format. The project will be determined from the directory provided. It will be removed in Nx v20.

skipTests.description: Do not create `spec.ts` test files for the new directive.

inlineScam.description: Create the `NgModule` in the same file as the Directive.

flat.description: Create the new files at the top level of the current project.
flat.x-deprecated: Provide the `directory` option instead and use the `as-provided` format. It will be removed in Nx v20.

selector.description: The `HTML` selector to use for this directive.

prefix.description: The prefix to apply to the generated directive selector.

export.description: Specifies if the SCAM should be exported from the project's entry point (normally `index.ts`). It only applies to libraries.
